name: Flan
description: A creamy caramel-topped custard dessert, known for its rich texture and vanilla flavor, a staple in Mexican cuisine.
steps: Melt sugar in a pan until golden and pour into a round baking dish, swirling to coat the bottom.
Blend eggs, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Pour the custard mixture over the caramelized sugar.
Place the dish in a larger baking pan and fill the pan with hot water halfway up the sides of the dish.
Bake in a water bath until set, about 45 minutes.
Cool and refrigerate before serving. Invert onto a plate to serve.
tips: Ensure the sugar is caramelized to a deep amber color for the best flavor.
Let the flan cool completely in the refrigerator to set properly before inverting.
Run a knife around the edges of the flan to loosen it from the dish before inverting.
